Sidebar.footer: is a cellular automaton devised by John Horton Conway. Cells live or die based on their neighbors.
Sidebar.rulesIntro: In the Game of Life, for any cell, the rules are as follows:
Sidebar.rulesContext: Each cell has two states - alive or dead, and interacts with the eight neighbors around it.
Sidebar.rule1: A live cell with fewer than 2 live neighbors dies (underpopulation).
Sidebar.rule2: A live cell with 2 or 3 live neighbors lives on to the next generation.
Sidebar.rule3: A live cell with more than 3 live neighbors dies (overpopulation).
Sidebar.rule4: A dead cell with exactly 3 live neighbors becomes a live cell (reproduction).
